meanings.definition: The arrangement of electrical components that make up a circuit.
meanings.sent1: The circuitry in the robot controls its movements.
meanings.sent2: The circuitry in the computer allows it to process information.
meanings.sent3: The circuitry in the toy car got tangled up with the string.
meanings.sent4: Her mind's circuitry was overloaded with thoughts of the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent5: The intricate circuitry of the motherboard resembled a complex puzzle.

meanings.definition: The interconnected pathways through which electrical current flows.
meanings.sent1: The circuitry of the house ensures electricity reaches every room.
meanings.sent2: The circuitry of the city's power grid is carefully maintained.
meanings.sent3: The circuitry of the old radio seemed to hum with a life of its own.
meanings.sent4: The circuitry of communication links people across vast distances.
meanings.sent5: The circuitry of the brain is like a network of tiny roads connecting thoughts.

meanings.definition: The system of circuits within a device or machine.
meanings.sent1: The circuitry of the smartphone enables various functions.
meanings.sent2: The circuitry of the alarm clock controls the time display.
meanings.sent3: The circuitry of the vending machine seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: The circuitry of the car's engine ensures smooth operation.
meanings.sent5: The circuitry of the security system protects the building from intruders.
